info.title: Nexigon Hub API
info.description:
Welcome to the Nexigon Hub API documentation!

Nexigon Hub offers an RPC-style HTTP API.

post.description: Query the users of the instance.
Get information about a user.
Create a new user.
Delete a user.
Set the display name of a user.
Set the password of a user.
Set whether the user is an instance administrator.
Query the tokens of a user.
Query the projects of a user.
Query the project invitations of a user.
Query the repositories of a user.
Query the repository invitations of a user.
Query the sessions of a user.
Authenticate a user with a token.
Authenticate a user with a session token.
Check the permissions of a user for a given device.
Create a user token.
Delete a user token.
Initiate a user session.
Terminate a user session.
Cleanup expired user sessions.
Register a new user with an email and password.
Complete the registration of a user.
Accept a project invitation.
Accept a repository invitation.
Query the projects of the instance.
Get information about a project.
Create a new project.
Delete a project.
Query the devices of a project.
Query the members of a project.
Query the outstanding invitations of a project.
Query the deployment tokens of a project.
Query repositories of a project.
Add a user to a project.
Remove a user from a project.
Invite a user to a project.
Delete an invitation to a project.
Create a deployment token.
Delete a deployment token.
Set the flags of a deployment token.
Query the audit log of the project.
Add a repository to the project.
Remove a repository from the project.
Query the devices of the instance.
Get information about a device.
Create a new device.
Delete a device.
Set the name of a device.
Set the metadata of a device.

Issue a JWT for a device with user-defined claims.

**Note: Only use this action for integration with external systems.**

Validate a device JWT.

**Note: Only use this action for integration with external systems.**

Authenticate a device.

**Note: The certificate fingerprint must be externally verified (mutual TLS).**
Add a device certificate.
Delete a device certificate.
Set the status of a device certificate.
Register a connection of a device to a cluster node.
Unregister a connection of a device to a cluster node.
Issue a HTTP proxy JWT.
Validate a HTTP proxy JWT.
Publish device events.
Query device events.
Resolve a repository by its name.
Get information about a repository.
Create a new repository.
Delete a repository.
Set the visibility of a repository.
Query the packages of a repository.
Query the assets of a repository.
Query the members of a repository.
Query the invitations of a repository.
Query repository projects.
Add a user to a repository.
Remove a user from a repository.
Invite a user to a repository.
Delete an invitation to a repository.
Resolve a package by its path.
Get information about a package.
Create a new package.
Delete a package.
Query the versions of a package.
Resolve a package version by its path.
Get information about a package version.
Create a new package version.
Delete a package version.
Add an assert to a package version.
Remove an asset from a package version.
Add tags to a version.
Remove tags from a version.
Resolve a version asset by its path.
Get information about an asset.
Create an asset.
Delete an asset.
Issue a URL for downloading an asset.
Issue a URL for uploading an asset.
Query the audit log of the repository.

Query the events recorded in the audit log.

Requires administrator permissions.

Query the actions recorded in the audit log.

Requires administrator permissions.
Query the jobs of the instance.
Get instance statistics.
Get the settings of the instance.
Set a setting of the instance.
Get information about the cluster.
Register a new cluster node.
Report the heartbeat of a cluster node.
Cleanup inactive cluster nodes.

Get the actor.

This action is used to get the actor that is used to invoke the action.

nexigon_api.actor.Actor.description: Actor that may invoke actions in the system.

nexigon_api.actor.AnonymousActor.description: Anonymous actor, typically used for unauthenticated actions.

nexigon_api.actor.DeviceActor.description: Device authenticated via a specific deployment token.

nexigon_api.actor.SystemActor.description: System actor, typically used for internal actions.

nexigon_api.actor.UserActor.description: User authenticated via a user session.

nexigon_api.actor.UserTokenActor.description: User authenticated via a specific token.

nexigon_api.audit.AuditLogAction.description:
Action recorded in the audit log.

Audit data is guaranteed to not contain any secret information.

nexigon_api.audit.AuditLogActionId.description: Unique ID of an audit log action.

nexigon_api.audit.AuditLogActionStatus.description: Status associated with an audit log action.

nexigon_api.audit.AuditLogEvent.description:
Event recorded in the audit log.

Audit data is guaranteed to not contain any secret information.

nexigon_api.audit.AuditLogEventId.description: Unique ID of an audit log event.

nexigon_api.audit.QueryAuditLogActionsOu.description: Output of querying the actions recorded in the audit log.

nexigon_api.audit.QueryAuditLogEventsOut.description: Output of querying the events recorded in the audit log.

nexigon_api.cluster.RegisterClusterNodeO.description: Output of registering a new cluster node.
